easy.title: Weight Weight… Don't Tell Me!
easy.question: How heavy is its bullet, probably?
easy.explanation: This appears to be a .45 ACP cartridge. The .45 ACP typically uses bullets weighing 185, 200, or 230 grains, making it one of the heavier handgun cartridges commonly used.

easy.title: Browning's Bright Ideas
easy.question: In which order were the following Automatic Colt Pistol cartridges designed?
easy.explanation: John Moses Browning designed these cartridges in the order: .32 ACP (1899), .45 ACP (1904), and .380 ACP (1908). The .32 ACP came first, followed by the powerful .45 ACP, and finally the .380 ACP.

easy.question: Which cartridge was used in the assassination of President Kennedy?
easy.explanation: The 6.5x52mm Carcano was the cartridge used in the Mannlicher-Carcano rifle during the assassination of President Kennedy in Dallas, Texas, on November 22, 1963.

easy.title: "I never miss."
easy.question: Which cartridge is James Bond's signature ammunition?
easy.explanation: In Ian Fleming's original novels, James Bond carried a .32 ACP in his Walther PPK. Though the films often showed him using other cartridges, the .32 ACP was his literary signature round.

easy.title: A Garand Old Time
easy.question: How heavy is its bullet, probably?
easy.explanation: The .30-06 Springfield, used in the M1 Garand rifle, typically fires bullets weighing 150, 165, or 180 grains. The 150-grain M2 Ball was the standard military load during WWII.

medium.title: No Pressure
medium.question: Which of the following *does not* have official +P specs?
medium.explanation: The .40 S&W does not have official +P specifications. While .9mm, .38 Special, and .45 ACP all have SAAMI-approved +P loadings, the .40 S&W was designed to operate at higher pressures from the start.

medium.title: Signed, SEALed, Delivered
medium.question: Which cartridge is primarily used by Navy SEALs for long-range precision work?
medium.explanation: The .338 Lapua Magnum is the preferred cartridge for Navy SEAL long-range precision rifles. It offers superior ballistics and accuracy at extended ranges compared to other options.

medium.title: Elmer's Pride
medium.question: What is its advertised muzzle velocity?
medium.explanation: The .44 Magnum, Elmer Keith's pride and joy, typically achieves a muzzle velocity of around 1,235 fps with a 240-grain bullet, making it one of the most powerful handgun cartridges.

medium.title: Let's Get It Started
medium.question: What cartridge did Gavrilo Princip use to assassinate Archduke Franz Ferdinand?
medium.explanation: Gavrilo Princip used a .380 ACP cartridge in his FN Model 1910 pistol to assassinate Archduke Franz Ferdinand in Sarajevo on June 28, 1914, sparking World War I.

medium.title: Because the South Atlantic Doesn't Matter
medium.question: Which of the following doesn't belong?
medium.explanation: The 7.62x35mm (.300 Blackout) is not a NATO standard cartridge. The others - 12.7x99mm (.50 BMG), 5.56x45mm, and 5.7x28mm - are all NATO standardized rounds.

medium.title: This Is Going to Sting
medium.question: Which of the following doesn't belong?
medium.explanation: The .17 Mosquito doesn't belong as it's not part of the classic family of small, fast cartridges. The .22 Hornet, .218 Bee, and .219 Wasp are all related high-velocity varmint cartridges from the same era.

hard.title: The Genuine ARticle
hard.question: What is its muzzle velocity out of a 20" barrel?
hard.explanation: The 5.56x45mm NATO cartridge achieves approximately 3,060 fps muzzle velocity from a 20-inch barrel with the standard M855 62-grain bullet, making it highly effective at intermediate ranges.

hard.title: Do You Feel Lucky?
hard.question: What cartridge did Clint Eastwood's character use in Dirty Harry?
hard.explanation: Dirty Harry's iconic .44 Magnum revolver fired the 10.9x33mmR (.44 Magnum) cartridge. This powerful round became famous from Clint Eastwood's character calling it 'the most powerful handgun in the world.'

hard.title: AR You Feeling It?
hard.question: Which of the following doesn't belong?
hard.explanation: The 6.5mm Creedmoor doesn't belong because it requires a larger AR-10 platform, while .22 LR, 6.5mm Grendel, and 5.56x45mm can all be used in AR-15 platform rifles with appropriate modifications.

hard.title: Winston's War Machine
hard.question: What cartridge does Winston Churchill's Tommy Gun fire?
hard.explanation: The Thompson submachine gun (Tommy Gun) that Winston Churchill is shown with fires the .45 ACP cartridge. The Tommy Gun was chambered in .45 ACP and became iconic during WWII for its stopping power.
